alert.note: Alert for Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:48AM EDT until March 25 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Elyria. * WHEN...Through tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding along the East Branch of the Black River on Foster Road in Penfield Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EDT Friday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 9.4 feet tomorrow evening then expected to rise to around flood stage again late Saturday night. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.0 feet on 03/23/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EDT.
